newsitem.title: JAPAN: Rubin says sticks with G7 Berlin statement.
newsitem.headline: Rubin says sticks with G7 Berlin statement.

text.p: U.S. Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin said on Friday he was sticking with a Group of Seven (G7) currency statement issued in Berlin after a meeting in February.

Asked about fluctuations in the dollar/yen exchange rate in the past two years and its impact on the global economy, he said: "I will stick with the currency statement made in the G7 meeting in Berlin."
He added that in the statement the G7 said the currency asymmetries that had been identified in the earlier stages had been cured.
He told a news conference in Tokyo that such asymmetries had first been identified by a G7 statement in April 1995.
Rubin made the comments after meetings with Japanese leaders including Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto and Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka.
